| Ausverkauft | Ã‰puisÃ© |
| Das ist der letzte | C'est le dernier |
| Nur noch in dieser Farbe | Plus que dans cette couleur |

## Payer

<VocabCard
  word="Ich mÃ¶chte bezahlen"
  translation="Je voudrais payer"
  pronunciation="[ich MEUCH-teu beu-TSA-leune]"
  example="Ich mÃ¶chte bezahlen. Kann ich mit Karte zahlen?"
/>

### Ã€ la caisse

- **Wo ist die Kasse?** [vo ist di KA-seu] - OÃ¹ est la caisse ?
- **Kann ich mit Karte zahlen?** - Puis-je payer par carte ?
- **Nehmen Sie Bargeld?** - Acceptez-vous le liquide ?
- **Brauchen Sie eine TÃ¼te?** - Avez-vous besoin d'un sac ?
- **Nein danke, ich habe eine** - Non merci, j'en ai un
- **Kann ich den Kassenbon haben?** - Puis-je avoir le ticket de caisse ?

<CultureTip title="Paiement en Allemagne" flag="ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª">
L'Allemagne est encore trÃ¨s attachÃ©e au paiement en liquide (Bargeld). Beaucoup de petits commerces n'acceptent pas les cartes, ou uniquement Ã  partir d'un certain montant. Ayez toujours du cash sur vous !
</CultureTip>

## Faire les courses alimentaires

<VocabCard
  word="der Einkaufswagen"
  translation="le caddie"
  pronunciation="[dÃ©r AÃNE-kaoufs-va-gueune]"
  example="Nimm einen Einkaufswagen, ich hole die Liste."
/>

### Au supermarchÃ©

| Allemand | FranÃ§ais |
|----------|----------|
| der Einkaufswagen | le caddie |
| der Einkaufskorb | le panier |
| die Einkaufsliste | la liste de courses |
| das Angebot | l'offre/la promo |
| das Regal | le rayon |
| die Frischetheke | le rayon frais |
| der Kassenbereich | la zone de caisse |
| die Pfandflaschen | les bouteilles consignÃ©es |

### Phrases utiles

- **Wo finde ich...?** [vo FIN-deu ich] - OÃ¹ puis-je trouver... ?
- **In welchem Gang ist...?** - Dans quel rayon est... ?
- **Brauchen wir noch Milch?** - On a encore besoin de lait ?
- **Das haben wir schon** - On en a dÃ©jÃ 
- **Steht das auf der Liste?** - C'est sur la liste ?

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Ich gehe schnell noch Brot holen"
  translation="Je vais vite chercher du pain"
  pronunciation="[ich GUÃ‰-eu chnel noch brot HO-leune]"
  context="Quand vous faites les courses ensemble et vous sÃ©parez"
/>

## MarchÃ©s et brocantes

<VocabCard
  word="der Wochenmarkt"
  translation="le marchÃ© hebdomadaire"
  pronunciation="[dÃ©r VO-cheune-markt]"
  example="Lass uns am Samstag zum Wochenmarkt gehen."
/>

### Au marchÃ©

- **Was kosten die Ã„pfel?** - Combien coÃ»tent les pommes ?
- **Ein Kilo, bitte** - Un kilo, s'il vous plaÃ®t
- **Das ist zu teuer** [dass ist tsou TOÃ-eur] - C'est trop cher
- **Kann ich probieren?** - Puis-je goÃ»ter ?
- **Ist das frisch?** - C'est frais ?
- **Ist das Bio?** [ist dass BI-o] - C'est bio ?

### NÃ©gocier (marchÃ© aux puces)

- **KÃ¶nnen Sie mir einen besseren Preis machen?** - Pouvez-vous me faire un meilleur prix ?
- **Das ist mir zu teuer** - C'est trop cher pour moi
- **Ich gebe Ihnen 20 Euro** - Je vous donne 20 euros
- **Letzter Preis?** [LÃˆTS-teur praÃ¯ss] - Dernier prix ?

## Exercices pratiques pour couples

### Exercice 1 : Liste de courses bilingue

Faites votre liste de courses ensemble, chacun Ã©crivant les produits dans les deux langues.

### Exercice 2 : Jeu de rÃ´le vendeur/client

L'un joue le vendeur, l'autre le client. Changez de rÃ´les et de scÃ©narios (vÃªtements, supermarchÃ©, marchÃ©).

### Exercice 3 : Shopping rÃ©el

Lors de votre prochaine sortie shopping, essayez de tout dire en allemand entre vous !

<VocabCard
  word="Lass uns shoppen gehen!"
  translation="Allons faire du shopping !"
  pronunciation="[lass ounss CHO-peune GUÃ‰-eune]"
  example="Es ist Samstag - lass uns shoppen gehen!"
/>

## Vocabulaire bonus : soldes et promos

| Allemand | FranÃ§ais |
|----------|----------|
| der Schlussverkauf | les soldes de fin de saison |
| der Winterschlussverkauf (WSV) | les soldes d'hiver |
| der Sommerschlussverkauf (SSV) | les soldes d'Ã©tÃ© |
| 50% Rabatt | 50% de rÃ©duction |
| Sonderangebot | offre spÃ©ciale |
| SchnÃ¤ppchen | bonne affaire |
| zwei zum Preis von einem | deux pour le prix d'un |

<CultureTip title="PÃ©riodes de soldes" flag="ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª">
Les grandes pÃ©riodes de soldes en Allemagne sont fin janvier (Winterschlussverkauf) et fin juillet (Sommerschlussverkauf). Le Black Friday est aussi devenu populaire. C'est le moment de faire de bonnes affaires !
</CultureTip>

## Erreurs courantes Ã  Ã©viter

1. **Dire Â« Je veux Â» au lieu de Â« Je voudrais Â»** : Â« Ich mÃ¶chte Â» est plus poli que Â« Ich will Â»

2. **Oublier les consignes** : En Allemagne, les bouteilles ont une consigne (Pfand). Gardez-les pour rÃ©cupÃ©rer votre argent !

3. **Tutoyer le vendeur** : Utilisez Â« Sie Â» avec les vendeurs que vous ne connaissez pas

## Prochaines Ã©tapes

Le shopping en allemand deviendra plus facile Ã  chaque sortie. Commencez par les supermarchÃ©s oÃ¹ les produits sont visibles, puis passez aux boutiques oÃ¹ vous devez plus communiquer.

articles.title: Italian Questions: How to Ask Your Partner Anything
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Questions are the heart of conversation. Whether you're getting to know your partner better, making plans together, or having deep late-night talks, knowing how to ask questions in Italian opens up endless possibilities for connection.

## Two Ways to Ask Questions

### Method 1: Rising Intonation (Most Common)

The easiest way to ask a question in Italian is simply to raise your voice at the end of a statement:

| Statement | Question |
|-----------|----------|
| Sei stanco. (You're tired.) | Sei stanco? (Are you tired?) |
| Ti piace. (You like it.) | Ti piace? (Do you like it?) |
| Vieni con me. (You're coming with me.) | Vieni con me? (Are you coming with me?) |

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Mi ami?"
  translation="Do you love me?"
  pronunciation="mee AH-mee"
  context="Simple and direct - just use rising intonation"
/>

### Method 2: Question Words

For specific information, use question words at the beginning:

<CultureTip title="No 'Do' Required!" flag="ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹">
Unlike English, Italian doesn't need a helping verb like "do" or "does" to form questions. Just use the question word + verb directly: "Cosa vuoi?" (What do you want?) - not "What do you want?"
</CultureTip>

## Essential Question Words

### Chi - Who

<VocabCard
  word="Chi sei tu per me?"
  translation="Who are you to me?"
  pronunciation="kee say too per meh"
  example="Sai chi sei tu per me? Sei tutto."
/>

| Question | Translation |
|----------|-------------|
| Chi Ã¨? | Who is it? |
| Chi viene stasera? | Who's coming tonight? |
| Con chi parli? | Who are you talking to? |
| Di chi Ã¨ questo? | Whose is this? |

### Che / Che cosa / Cosa - What

All three mean "what" and are interchangeable:

<VocabCard
  word="Cosa pensi?"
  translation="What do you think?"
  pronunciation="KO-zah PEN-see"
  example="Ho un'idea. Cosa pensi?"
/>

| Question | Translation |
|----------|-------------|
| Che fai? | What are you doing? |
| Cosa vuoi? | What do you want? |
| Che cosa significa? | What does it mean? |
| Che succede? | What's happening? |

### Dove - Where

<VocabCard
  word="Dove sei stato/a tutto il giorno?"
  translation="Where have you been all day?"
  pronunciation="DOH-veh say STAH-toh/tah TOOT-toh eel JOR-no"
  example="Mi sei mancato/a! Dove sei stato tutto il giorno?"
/>

| Question | Translation |
|----------|-------------|
| Dove sei? | Where are you? |
| Dove andiamo? | Where are we going? |
| Di dove sei? | Where are you from? |
| Dove ci incontriamo? | Where shall we meet? |

### Quando - When

<VocabCard
  word="Quando ci vediamo?"
  translation="When will we see each other?"
  pronunciation="KWAN-doh chee veh-dee-AH-mo"
  example="Mi manchi giÃ ! Quando ci vediamo?"
/>

| Question | Translation |
|----------|-------------|
| Quando parti? | When are you leaving? |
| Quando sei libero/a? | When are you free? |
| Da quando? | Since when? |
| Fino a quando? | Until when? |

### PerchÃ© - Why / Because

<VocabCard
  word="PerchÃ© mi ami?"
  translation="Why do you love me?"
  pronunciation="per-KEH mee AH-mee"
  example="Dimmi, perchÃ© mi ami?"
/>

| Question | Translation |
|----------|-------------|
| PerchÃ© piangi? | Why are you crying? |
| PerchÃ© no? | Why not? |
| PerchÃ© sorridi? | Why are you smiling? |
| PerchÃ© sei cosÃ¬ speciale? | Why are you so special? |

<CultureTip title="PerchÃ© Does Double Duty" flag="ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹">
"PerchÃ©" means both "why" (in questions) and "because" (in answers). Q: "PerchÃ© sorridi?" (Why are you smiling?) A: "PerchÃ© ti amo." (Because I love you.)
</CultureTip>

### Come - How

<VocabCard
  word="Come stai, amore mio?"
  translation="How are you, my love?"
  pronunciation="KO-meh stah-ee, ah-MORE-eh MEE-oh"
  example="Buongiorno! Come stai, amore mio?"
/>

| Question | Translation |
|----------|-------------|
| Come ti chiami? | What's your name? |
| Come va? | How's it going? |
| Come mai? | How come? |
| Come ti senti? | How do you feel? |

### Quanto/a/i/e - How much / How many

<VocabCard
  word="Quanto mi ami?"
  translation="How much do you love me?"
  pronunciation="KWAN-toh mee AH-mee"
  example="Dimmi, quanto mi ami?"
/>

| Question | Translation |
|----------|-------------|
| Quanto costa? | How much does it cost? |
| Quanti anni hai? | How old are you? |
| Quanto tempo ci vuole? | How long does it take? |
| Quante volte? | How many times? |

### Quale/i - Which

<VocabCard
  word="Quale preferisci?"
  translation="Which one do you prefer?"
  pronunciation="KWAH-leh preh-feh-REE-shee"
  example="Ci sono due ristoranti. Quale preferisci?"
/>

| Question | Translation |
|----------|-------------|
| Qual Ã¨ il tuo preferito? | Which is your favorite? |
| Quale film vuoi vedere? | Which movie do you want to watch? |
| Quali sono i tuoi sogni? | What are your dreams? |

## Romantic Questions to Ask Your Partner

### Getting to Know Each Other Better

<VocabCard
  word="Qual Ã¨ il tuo ricordo piÃ¹ bello?"
  translation="What is your most beautiful memory?"
  pronunciation="kwahl eh eel TOO-oh ree-KOR-doh pyoo BEL-loh"
  example="Raccontami, qual Ã¨ il tuo ricordo piÃ¹ bello?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Cosa ti rende felice?"
  translation="What makes you happy?"
  pronunciation="KO-zah tee REN-deh feh-LEE-cheh"
  example="Voglio sapere tutto di te. Cosa ti rende felice?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Di cosa hai paura?"
  translation="What are you afraid of?"
  pronunciation="dee KO-zah AH-ee pah-OO-rah"
  example="Puoi dirmelo. Di cosa hai paura?"
/>

### About Your Relationship

<VocabCard
  word="Cosa ti ha fatto innamorare di me?"
  translation="What made you fall in love with me?"
  pronunciation="KO-zah tee ah FAHT-toh in-nah-mo-RAH-reh dee meh"
  example="Sono curioso/a... cosa ti ha fatto innamorare di me?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Come ci vedi fra dieci anni?"
  translation="How do you see us in ten years?"
  pronunciation="KO-meh chee VEH-dee frah dee-EH-chee AHN-nee"
  example="Parliamo del futuro. Come ci vedi fra dieci anni?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Qual Ã¨ il nostro momento piÃ¹ bello insieme?"
  translation="What is our most beautiful moment together?"
  pronunciation="kwahl eh eel NOS-tro mo-MEN-toh pyoo BEL-loh in-see-EH-meh"
  example="Per me Ã¨ stato quando... e per te? Qual Ã¨ il nostro momento piÃ¹ bello insieme?"
/>

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Vuoi invecchiare con me?"
  translation="Do you want to grow old with me?"
  pronunciation="vwoy in-vek-kee-AH-reh kon meh"
  context="A beautiful question about your future together"
/>

### Everyday Questions

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| Hai fame? | Are you hungry? |
| Sei stanco/a? | Are you tired? |
| Vuoi un caffÃ¨? | Do you want a coffee? |
| Ti va di uscire? | Do you feel like going out? |
| Cosa facciamo stasera? | What shall we do tonight? |
| A che ora torni? | What time are you coming back? |
| Hai bisogno di qualcosa? | Do you need anything? |
| Ti posso aiutare? | Can I help you? |

### Questions for Planning Together

<VocabCard
  word="Dove andiamo in vacanza quest'anno?"
  translation="Where are we going on vacation this year?"
  pronunciation="DOH-veh ahn-dee-AH-mo in vah-KAHN-tsah kwest-AHN-no"
  example="Dobbiamo decidere: dove andiamo in vacanza quest'anno?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Cosa vuoi fare per il tuo compleanno?"
  translation="What do you want to do for your birthday?"
  pronunciation="KO-zah vwoy FAH-reh per eel TOO-oh kohm-pleh-AHN-no"
  example="Il tuo compleanno si avvicina! Cosa vuoi fare?"
/>

## Tag Questions

Add these to the end of statements to turn them into questions:

| Tag | Meaning | Example |
|-----|---------|---------|
| **vero?** | right? | Ti piace, vero? |
| **no?** | no? / right? | Vieni stasera, no? |
| **giusto?** | correct? | Partiamo alle otto, giusto? |
| **non Ã¨ vero?** | isn't it? | Ãˆ bello qui, non Ã¨ vero? |

<VocabCard
  word="Mi ami, vero?"
  translation="You love me, right?"
  pronunciation="mee AH-mee VEH-ro"
  example="Lo so giÃ , ma dimmi: mi ami, vero?"
/>

## Would You Like...? / Do You Want...?

### Vuoi...? (Do you want...?)

| Question | Translation |
|----------|-------------|
| Vuoi qualcosa da bere? | Do you want something to drink? |
| Vuoi venire con me? | Do you want to come with me? |
| Vuoi che ti aiuti? | Do you want me to help you? |
| Vuoi parlarne? | Do you want to talk about it? |

### Ti va di...? (Do you feel like...?)

<VocabCard
  word="Ti va di fare una passeggiata?"
  translation="Do you feel like taking a walk?"
  pronunciation="tee vah dee FAH-reh OO-nah pahs-sed-JAH-tah"
  example="Ãˆ una bella serata. Ti va di fare una passeggiata?"
/>

| Question | Translation |
|----------|-------------|
| Ti va di uscire? | Do you feel like going out? |
| Ti va di guardare un film? | Do you feel like watching a movie? |
| Ti va di cucinare insieme? | Do you feel like cooking together? |

### Ti piacerebbe...? (Would you like...?)

<VocabCard
  word="Ti piacerebbe visitare l'Italia con me?"
  translation="Would you like to visit Italy with me?"
  pronunciation="tee pee-ah-cheh-REH-beh vee-zee-TAH-reh lee-TAH-lee-ah kon meh"
  example="Un giorno, ti piacerebbe visitare l'Italia con me?"
/>

## Practice Conversations

### Planning the Evening

**Partner A:** Cosa facciamo stasera?
**Partner B:** Non so. Ti va di uscire o restiamo a casa?
**Partner A:** Dove vorresti andare?
**Partner B:** Che ne dici di quel nuovo ristorante?
**Partner A:** Perfetto! A che ora partiamo?

### Getting to Know Each Other

**Partner A:** Qual Ã¨ il tuo sogno piÃ¹ grande?
**Partner B:** Viaggiare per il mondo con te. E il tuo?
**Partner A:** Anch'io! Dove vorresti andare prima?
**Partner B:** Forse il Giappone. PerchÃ© me lo chiedi?
**Partner A:** PerchÃ© voglio conoscere tutti i tuoi sogni.

### Checking In

**Partner A:** Come ti senti oggi?
**Partner B:** Un po' stanco. PerchÃ©?
**Partner A:** Hai bisogno di qualcosa?
**Partner B:** Solo di te. Vieni qui?

## Practice Exercises for Couples

### Exercise 1: 20 Questions
Play 20 questions in Italian! One person thinks of something, the other asks yes/no questions:
- Ãˆ una persona? (Is it a person?)
- Ãˆ grande? (Is it big?)
- Si trova in casa? (Is it in the house?)

### Exercise 2: Interview Each Other
Take turns asking these questions:
- Qual Ã¨ il tuo colore preferito?
- Cosa ti piace fare nel tempo libero?
- Dove vorresti vivere?
- Qual Ã¨ il tuo piatto preferito?

### Exercise 3: Plan Something Together
Use only questions to plan an activity:
- Dove andiamo?
- Quando partiamo?
- Cosa portiamo?
- Chi invitiamo?

## Quick Reference Card

| Question Word | Meaning | Example |
|---------------|---------|---------|
| Chi? | Who? | Chi Ã¨? |
| Cosa? | What? | Cosa fai? |
| Dove? | Where? | Dove sei? |
| Quando? | When? | Quando vieni? |
| PerchÃ©? | Why? | PerchÃ© ridi? |
| Come? | How? | Come stai? |
| Quanto? | How much? | Quanto costa? |
| Quale? | Which? | Quale vuoi? |

<VocabCard
  word="Posso farti una domanda?"
  translation="Can I ask you a question?"
  pronunciation="POS-so FAR-tee OO-nah doh-MAHN-dah"
  example="Scusa, posso farti una domanda importante?"
/>

Asking questions in Italian will transform your conversations from basic exchanges to meaningful dialogues. The more questions you ask each other in Italian, the more you'll learn - about the language and about each other. **Buona fortuna!** (Good luck!)

<CTA text="Ready to ask beautiful questions in Italian?" buttonText="Start Learning Now" />
